subject: Relationships
title: Trust: A Calculated Gamble
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Trust: A Calculated Gamble.

hook.text: Every time you trust someone, your brain runs a risk calculation. Trust isn't a feeling â€” it's a bet.

buildup.text: Neuroscience shows trust involves the prefrontal cortex weighing evidence and the amygdala assessing threat.

discovery.text: The brain asks: 'What's the probability this person will act in my interest?' Then it decides to trust or not.

twist.text: We think trust is about character. It's really about prediction. We trust people whose behavior we can forecast.

climax.text: Trust isn't blind faith. It's the brain's prediction engine deciding someone is safe enough to be vulnerable with.

punchline.text: Trust isn't a feeling. It's your brain calculating a bet on someone.

quiz.question: What is trust, neurologically?
options: A risk calculation by the brain
An instinct that can't be analyzed
